metadata.synopsis: The mutinous duergar tells the player what comes next for them: an assault on Moonrise Towers.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -625.75, 14.74, 354.754. Talk with Elder Brithvar, convince him you are not a true soul (deception roll) and accept to help him for a fee (half the gold - persuasion roll).5. CTRL-Shift-K the Scrying eye.6. Destroy the rubbles holding Nere captive.7. Side with Brithvar and use killcombat to kill all of the loyals + Nere.8. Talk with Brithvar

56.speaker: Elder Brithvar
56.text: Sschindylryn's shithouse - you see it? Cock-stench had a wriggler in his skull. All the more reason to clear out.

51.speaker: Elder Brithvar
51.text: Here's your cut. Extra too, like I promised. ([463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

28.speaker: Elder Brithvar
28.text: Here's your cut. I always keep my word. ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

40.speaker: Elder Brithvar
40.text: Clan: grab your gear, wipe your arses.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

24.speaker: Elder Brithvar
24.text: Time I scrammed before more pricks from Moonrise Towers move in.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: And the slaves? What about them?
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

18.speaker: Elder Brithvar
18.text: Clan property. They come with us.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Speak up, chief. You can't just let the clan keep them.
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

41.speaker: Wyll
41.text: Speak up, chief. You can't just let the clan keep them.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

9.speaker: Player
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

5.speaker: Player
5.text: The gnomes go free. You get to live. Everybody wins.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

20.speaker: Elder Brithvar
20.text: Try it, ya uppity shit, see what happens.

19.text: Try it, ya uppity shit, see what happens.

44.speaker: Elder Brithvar
44.text: Try it, ya uppity shit, see what happens.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Set them free, or I will thrash you like I thrashed Nere.
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

15.speaker: Elder Brithvar
15.text: Won't hear me argue. Your mouth's got the might to back it.
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

31.speaker: Elder Brithvar
31.text: Won't hear me argue. Your mouth's got the might to back it.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

2.speaker: Elder Brithvar
2.text: Gnome-pricks: you're off the hook. Scram, before I get my senses.
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

11.text: Then do it, ya shit. We'll see who thrashes who.

43.speaker: Elder Brithvar
43.text: Then do it, ya shit. We'll see who thrashes who.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Let the gnomes go. They'll just slow you down.

65.speaker: Elder Brithvar
65.text: Mm - you got a point. Likely to be all hobbled up, what with the lashings.

10.speaker: Elder Brithvar
10.text: Mm - you got a point. Likely to be all hobbled up, what with the lashings.

49.text: Hardly. They drag their feet, and I'll scorch their arses. Works every time.

36.speaker: Elder Brithvar
36.text: Hardly. They drag their feet, and I'll scorch their arses. Works every time.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Good idea. They're a valuable asset.

68.speaker: Elder Brithvar
68.text: Born to serve, my father said. I'll keep 'em busy.

30.speaker: Elder Brithvar
30.text: Mm. For a jargh, you got smarts.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Have you no heart? They deserved freedom - and you denied it.

39.speaker: Wyll
39.text: Have you no heart? They deserved freedom - and you denied it.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Brittle are the foundations upon which the houses of tyrants are built. It seems I judged you to be less brittle than you really are.

42.speaker: Gale
42.text: Brittle are the foundations upon which the houses of tyrants are built. It seems I judged you to be less brittle than you really are.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: You can't be serious. What the fuck is wrong with you?

17.speaker: Karlach
17.text: You can't be serious. What the fuck is wrong with you?

25.speaker: Player
25.text: The gnomes should be able to go where they please. They are not the duergar's to keep.

4.speaker: Gale
4.text: The gnomes should be able to go where they please. They are not the duergar's to keep.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: No way we're letting these bastards take those gnomes. Right?

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: No way we're letting these bastards take those gnomes. Right?

16.speaker: Player
16.text: What makes Moonrise Towers such a threat?
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general.NodeContext: Said to the room.

37.speaker: Elder Brithvar
37.text: Your brain going mushy, jargh? That's where those Absolute-freaks hole up.

48.speaker: Elder Brithvar
48.text: Goblins, drow, gnolls, even humans - ain't no one they won't try to turn.

34.speaker: Elder Brithvar
34.text: The way I hear tell, some prick there calls the shots. The General, Nere called him.

14.speaker: Elder Brithvar
14.text: And there ain't no way I'm sticking around long enough to meet him.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Get moving. If I see you slavers again, I'll tear you apart.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general.NodeContext: Said to the room.

29.speaker: Elder Brithvar
29.text: Please. We catch your scent, and you'll get sliced 'fore you can bat your left eye.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general.NodeContext: Said to the room.

60.speaker: Elder Brithvar
60.text: Now lug your arse someplace else - I got to get cracking.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general.NodeContext: Said to the room.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Leave - and take the slaves with you. Before I change my mind.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: And the gold you owe me?

64.speaker: Elder Brithvar
64.text: Someone's gone pickin' my pockets, ya chaff. You want coin, there's plenty of corpses to sack.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Good idea. I'll start by adding your corpse to the pile.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Very well. I'll rummage what I can.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I am freeing these gnomes. Just try and stop me.

61.speaker: Elder Brithvar
61.text: Your wish is my command, jargh.
